RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 1 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 58. Maiden Claiming Purse 20600. FOR MAIDENS, THREE, FOUR, FIVE, AND SIX YEARS OLD. Three Year Olds, 118 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Claiming Price $12,500, if for $10,000, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: STORM TRAPPE drew clear while tapering to the inside and rated the pace, came under pressure leaving the five sixteenths pole, raced at the rail on the turn and was steadily encouraged through the lane. GLASTONBURY stalked the early pace inside, eased out with a bid leaving the three eighths pole and rounded the turn off the rail, drifted toward the eighth pole and ran evenly down the lane. BASHDAFLASH came away rank and lost his blinkers soon after the start, moved to the outside to give chase, rounded the turn about the five path and finished evenly to take third later yards. MONEY MAC chased through the backstretch, rounded the turn about the three path, left the turn outside then flattened stride. FROSTY THE BULL chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and showed little in the lane. MY SLICK NICK gave chase and raced in the three path on the turn. BOCCHERINI saved ground.

ENTRY.NAME: Bashdaflash
ENTRY.COMMENT: rank break,lost blinkers,chased outside,5p turn,evenly lane

ENTRY.NAME: Glastonbury
ENTRY.COMMENT: stalked inside,eased out,bid 3/8,off rail turn,drifted,even fnish

ENTRY.NAME: Storm Trappe
ENTRY.COMMENT: drew clear,moved in,rated pace,rail turn,steady urging lane

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 2 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 50. Claiming Purse 13300. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500, allowed 2 lbs.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: ALLI BOBBY exchanged contact with WAGER WORTHY leaving the gate and settled off the rail on the opening turn, advanced between horses leaving the seven sixteenths pole and took aim at the rail approaching the quarter, took the lead midway on the far turn, drew clear toward the head of the lane and was steadily handled to hold on well. The latter exchanged contact with Alli Bobby leaving the gate and was jostled a stride or two later then stalked two deep, picked up the chase nearing the three eighths pole, raced close in the three path of the far turn and ran evenly down the lane. APPEALING ROAD exchanged contact with Quincys Way early then rated the pace inside, came under pressure leaving the three eighths pole, was met and dropped back from between horses midway on the far turn and flattened inside the eighth pole. I SHALLBE RELEASED exchanged contact with Wager Worthy soon after the start then raced in the four path on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole and entered the far turn in the four path, moved to the rail midway on the turn and weakened in the lane. DEREKA'S BLUFF raced in the four path the first turn, picked up the chase outside leaving the turn but flattened in the four path of the far turn. QUINCYS WAY exchanged contact with Appealing Road soon after the start and rated close inside on the first turn, but faded leaving the three eighths pole.

ENTRY.NAME: Alli Bobby
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,off rail 1st turn,aim rail 1/4,up mid turn,driving

ENTRY.NAME: I Shallbe Released
ENTRY.COMMENT: bumped break,4p 1st turn,chased 3/8,4p into far turn,weakened

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 3 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 69. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: TIMETOGETUP chased the pace through the backstretch, drifted outward toward the five sixteenths pole, raced in the five path of the turn and dug in to get up the final yards. CHEROKEE CASTLE chased and raced close off the rail on the turn, dug in from the head of the lane to take second from. CASTLE TOY in the final yards but was outfinished for the win. The latter was hustled to the front and rated the early pace, came under pressure at the quarter pole, contested the edge nearest the rail on the turn, dug in through the stretch but was met in the final yards then nipped from second under the wire. WINDSOR'S PLAY chased through the backstretch, raced in range of the lead in the three path on the turn and ran evenly in the stretch. SIENTE LA BRISA was reluctant to load, gave chase outside, rounded the turn about the six path and closed the gap widest in the lane. GLOBAL EMPRESS chased through the backstretch but was shut off at the outside flank of Timetogetup approaching the five sixteenths pole, then flattened at the rail on the turn. LEMONSONDESURPRISE chased inside, raced near the rail on the turn and showed little in the lane.

ENTRY.NAME: Castle Toy
ENTRY.COMMENT: hustled to front,pressured 1/4,rail turn,met late,nipped 2nd wire

ENTRY.NAME: Siente La Brisa
ENTRY.COMMENT: reluctant to load,chased outside,6p turn,closed gap widest

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 4 7F Dirt CR: 72. Allowance Purse 35100. FOR ACCREDITED WEST VIRGINIA-BRED FILLIES AND MARES THREE YEARS OLD AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON THREE RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Race s Where Entered For $15,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BARBERS POINT took over leaving the thirteen sixteenths pole and moved to the inside to rate the pace, was given enough rein to keep the advantage over PEARLY GHOST and May Mays Castle through the backstretch, rounded the far turn near the rail and widened of her own initiative to win handily. PEARLY GHOST raced hemmed at the rail on the first turn then stalked into the backstretch, gave chase nearing the seven sixteenths pole, raced close in the three path on the far turn and dueled through the stretch to take the nod for second. NO DENYING DENIS was bumped at the break then settled inside on the first turn, bid nearing the three eighths pole, raced off the rail on the far turn and was outfinished in the stretch duel for second. ELIANAGRACE rounded the opening turn in the four path, bid leaving the three eighths pole, raced in the three path of the far turn and ran evenly in the lane. DIXIE YODELER settled off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole, rounded the far turn off the rail and passed rivals. TENNIS TAP came out to make contact with May Mays Castle leaving the gate, rounded the first turn in the three path and showed little response through the backstretch. EX RATED saved ground. MAY MAYS CASTLE was jostled and exchanged contact with No Denying Denis at the break, raced off the rail on the first turn, picked up the chase from the three eighths pole then faded off the rail on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Pearly Ghost
ENTRY.OWNER: Mountain View Racing LLC and Golden Melinda B

ENTRY.NAME: May Mays Castle
ENTRY.COMMENT: jostled break,bumped,stalked off rail,chased 3/8,faded far turn

ENTRY.NAME: Barbers Point
ENTRY.COMMENT: rated pace inside,kept edge from 1/2,rail far turn,widen handily

ENTRY.NAME: Dixie Yodeler
ENTRY.COMMENT: off rail,bid 3/8,off rail far turn,passed rivals

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 5 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 70. Claiming Purse 19400. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $10,000, For Each $1,000 To $8,000 1 lb. (W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility)(Races Whe re Entered For $6,250 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: PRIMETIME JET chased from the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the turn and dug in to take the nod at the wire. BIGZ'S CABANA BOY bobbled while exchanging contact with Doc Elm leaving the gate, closed to the lead at the seven sixteenths pole and showed the way, widened at the rail on the far turn, dug in under steady stretch encouragement but was nipped under the wire and just lasted for second. THE ILLUSIONIST chased outside, raced close in the three path of the turn, was outfinished in the duel through the stretch but just missed taking second from the waning pace-setter. DANCIN IN DUBAI chased inside, rounded the turn near the rail and ran evenly in the lane. CAJUN FUN gave chase toward the inside, eased outward through the turn and entered the stretch about the seven path and could only close the gap. HE IS BONAFIDE chased toward the inside, rounded the turn off the rail, drifted leaving the turn and showed little in the lane. DOC ELM bobbled and exchanged contact with Bigz's Cabana Boy leaving the gate, gave chase through the backstretch, raced off the rail on the turn and showed little. SCOOTSCOOT gave chase and rounded the turn about the six path.

ENTRY.NAME: Dancin in Dubai
ENTRY.OWNER: Irish Hill Century Farm and McGuire Matthew

ENTRY.NAME: Cajun Fun
ENTRY.OWNER: Holly Ridge Farm, LLC and Collins, Timothy

ENTRY.NAME: Primetime Jet
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased,rail turn,dug in lane,nod under wire

ENTRY.NAME: The Illusionist
ENTRY.OWNER: Brown Nicole and Brown Ronney W

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 6 1 1/16M Dirt CR: 94. Allowance Optional Claiming Purse 30700. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON A RACE OTHER THAN MAIDEN, CLAIMING, STARTER, WAIVER CLAIMING, RESTRICTED OR STATE BRED RACES OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES OR CLAIMING PRICE $15,000. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-w inners Of A Race At A Mile Or Over Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Such A Race Since February 21 Allowed 4 lbs. Claiming Price $15,000 (Races Where Entered For $10,000 Or Less Not Considered In Weight Allowances)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: WELLING settled close inside then took over toward the three quarter pole and rated the pace, came under pressure approaching the five sixteenths, rounded the far turn at the rail and was steadily encouraged in the lane. LATE NIGHT LARRY had the early lead then stalked off the rail nearing the three quarter pole, gave chase from the seven sixteenths, raced off the rail on the far turn but had to settle for second best. MAXIMUM IMPACT saved ground, started a bid leaving the half mile pole, rounded the far turn near the rail and dueled through the stretch for third. HOBE SOUND settled off the rail, picked up the chase from the seven sixteenths pole, rounded the far turn about the three path and was outfinished in the stretch duel for third. RRACE DAY WARRIOR settled back in the two and three paths, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole but showed little response. KING THEO raced four wide early and gave chase outside leaving the second turn, but weakened while saving ground on the far turn.

ENTRY.NAME: Hobe Sound
ENTRY.OWNER: Eastham Richard and Brown Ronney W

ENTRY.NAME: Rrace Day Warrior
ENTRY.OWNER: Boggs M Joanna and Shade Tree Farm LLC

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 7 6 1/2F Dirt CR: 79. Allowance Purse 33900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NEVER WON TWO RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of A Race Since March 21 Allowed 2 lbs. A Race Since February 21 Allowed 4 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $12,500 Or Less Not Considered I n Weight Allowances) NO WVB CLAUSE.
RACE.FOOTNOTES: BRISTOL CHANNEL rated close to the early pace inside then eased out and stalked into the backstretch, dueled for the lead approaching the five sixteenths pole, contested the edge two deep on the far turn, drew clear passing the sixteenth pole and edged away late yards. COLLECTORATE took the lead leaving the three quarter pole and rated the pace, was met and dueled from the five sixteenths pole, contested at a close disadvantage nearest the rail on the turn but relented mid-stretch. SEAN THE HAMMER saved ground on the first turn then started a three wide bid leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced three wide on the far turn and flattened inside the sixteenth pole. URBAN BANDIT settled off the rail on the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, raced two deep on the far turn and flattened in the lane. MIGHTY MINION rounded the first turn about the three path, picked up the chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced in the four path of the far turn and showed little in the lane. PER DIEM settled in the three path the first turn, gave chase from the seven sixteenths pole, came through the far turn four wide and weakened. CHERRYS CROSS raced well back in the five path the first turn and showed little response through the backstretch. MIMS HAT TRICK came away awkwardly then saved ground, gave chase leaving the seven sixteenths pole, raced near the rail on the far turn and weakened in the lane. MALIBU ROCK STAR was never a factor.

ENTRY.NAME: Sean the Hammer
ENTRY.COMMENT: saved ground,3wd bid 7/16,3wd far turn,flattened late

RACE.RACE_TEXT: CHARLES TOWN RACE 8 4 1/2F Dirt CR: 81. Claiming Purse 16900. FOR THREE YEAR OLDS AND UPWARD WHICH HAVE NOT WON TWO RACES SINCE OCTOBER 21, 2022 OR WHICH HAVE NEVER WON FOUR RACES. Three Year Olds, 120 lbs.; Older, 124 lbs. Non-winners Of Two Races Since October 21 Allowed 2 lbs. Claiming Price $5,000, if for $4,500 , allowed 2 lbs. (Races Where Entered For $4,000 Or Less Not Considered In Eligibility)(W V A Races Not Considered In Eligibility).
RACE.FOOTNOTES: MOJAC KAT gave chase through the backstretch, rounded the turn near the rail, dug in for the lead nearing mid-stretch and dueled clear later yards. BELIEVEINROCKNROLL chased inside, raced close off the rail on the turn and dueled for second while outfinished for the win. STEVETHEVANDRIVER set a pressured pace leaving the chute, raced near the rail on the turn, was met toward mid-stretch and relented later yards. FU MAN SUE chased through the backstretch, raced in the five and six paths on the turn and passed rivals widest. MI GUSTO ES chased the pace through the backstretch, rounded the turn in the three path, drifted into the lane and flattened stride. MOSS BOSS chased outside, raced in the six and seven paths of the turn, angled in nearing the eighth pole and finished evenly. MACY'S BOY chased, raced near the rail on the turn and ran evenly in the lane. BIG DADDY D R lunged leaving the gate then bobbled at the rail approaching the eighth pole. STARSHIP TAXI gave chase and rounded the turn about the four path.

ENTRY.NAME: Believeinrocknroll
ENTRY.OWNER: Oller John and C and B Stables

ENTRY.NAME: Stevethevandriver
ENTRY.COMMENT: set pressured pace,rail turn,met near 1/16,relented later yards

ENTRY.NAME: Moss Boss
ENTRY.COMMENT: chased outside,6& 7p turn,angled in near 1/8,even finish
